title: Mg in HCl Net Ionic Equation

content.description: A <math alttext="0.50 gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="M g, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> was placed in a solution of <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where it reacted completely.
content.question: Which of the following equations best represents the reacting species in the reaction described above?

choices.label: <math alttext="M g, solid, plus, 2 H with a positive one charge, aqueous, react to produce, M g with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, H 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M g, solid, plus, H C l, aqueous, react to produce, M g C l 2, aqueous, plus, H 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mtext>HC</mtext><mtext>l</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>MgCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M g, solid, plus, 2 H C l, aqueous, react to produce, M g C l 2, aqueous, plus, 2 H with a positive one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>MgCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M g, solid, plus, 2 H C l, aqueous, react to produce, M g with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus C l 2, gas, plus, H 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="M g, solid, plus, 2 H with a positive one charge, aqueous, react to produce, M g with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, H 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Mg</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
